title: 'I've always thought I was British'
description: BBC Panorama speaks to young people who say their dreams have been crushed due to their immigration status.

title: Covid cases at Everest base camp raise fears of serious outbreak
description: Climbers say a growing number of people have tested positive, despite government denials.

title: Napoleon's incendiary legacy divides France 200 years on
description: Dictatorship and slavery taint the Napoleonic reforms that shaped modern France.

title: Elections 2021: 'Parents shouldn't have to fight for child's care'
description: A mum believes her disabled son is being failed by the social care system.

title: Atlantic Ocean voyage ‘the hardest thing I’ve ever done’
description: Johnny Ward is part of a four-man rowing team that has crossed the Atlantic Ocean in a single boat.

title: The newborn calf that crashed our wedding
description: Wearing her wedding dress, dairy farmer Jessa Laws waded into knee-deep mud to aid a pregnant cow.

title: The company where colleagues decide your salary
description: A software firm in Argentina is trying a radical experiment in employee transparency and democracy.

title: 'Fight's off' - Saunders in ring dispute with Alvarez
description: Billy Joe Saunders does not attend a media obligation amid a dispute over the ring for his fight with Saul 'Canelo' Alvarez.

title: Biden Carter: What’s going on in this picture?
description: How the apparent size difference between the Bidens and the Carters came about.

title: Jose Mourinho: Why Roma job will be like no other for former Chelsea, Manchester United & Tottenham boss
description: For the first time in his career Jose Mourinho will not be expected to deliver trophies in the short term, so what can he expect at Roma?

title: Covid-19: Care home residents can go on outdoor trips without isolating
description: People in residential care in England are now allowed low-risk trips outside without isolating afterwards.

title: Elections 2021: How the BBC reports polling day
description: The BBC is not allowed to report details of campaigning while the polls are open.

title: Mexico City metro overpass collapse kills 23
description: Two train carriages plunged to the ground when an elevated metro line collapsed.

title: Dalian Atkinson: PC Benjamin Monk Tasered ex-footballer for 30 seconds
description: Murder-accused PC Benjamin Monk Tasered Dalian Atkinson for over 30 seconds in 2016, a court hears.

title: Odeon to reopen most cinemas in May with new safety measures in place
description: Following rival Cineworld, Odeon plans to reopen sites with new safety measures in place.

title: IPL suspended after rise in Covid-19 cases among players
description: The Indian Premier League is suspended after an increase in coronavirus cases among players.

title: Seven hurt in Willesborough house explosion
description: The front of a property was destroyed in a blast which left residents trapped in a row of houses.

title: Wada & UCI tensions over Froome case revealed
description: Tensions between the World Anti-Doping Agency and cycling's governing body over the controversial closure of the investigation into four-time Tour de France winner Chris Froome's use of salbutamol in 2018 are revealed.

title: Westbrook, Curry and Anthony shine in NBA
description: Russell Westbrook, Stephen Curry and Carmelo Anthony star, but Monday night belongs to the New York Knicks who record their 12th win in 13 games.

title: Royal Marines test out jet suit
description: The Royal Marines are testing out a jet suit to assist in Maritime Boarding Operations.

title: Four-time world champion Selby will not chase records of snooker's 'all-time greats'
description: Mark Selby says he is not preoccupied with records set by the game's "all-time greats" after winning a fourth World Championship on Monday.

title: Stuart Lubbock: CPS to consider charges over Barrymore party death
description: A file is being sent to prosecutors as part of the inquiry into the death of Stuart Lubbock in 2001.

title: Abbie Quinnen reveals 'horrible' Instagram abuse over burns
description: Abbie Quinnen says trolls targeted her after she suffered burns when a social media stunt went wrong.

title: Stock cubes help runner smash record on 212-mile route
description: Anna Rutherford beat the Southern Upland Way record by 17 hours, just nine months after giving birth.

title: G7: Foreign ministers to discuss rising threats at London summit
description: UK Foreign Secretary Dominic Raab will lead the first face-to-face talks in more than two years.

title: Teens, tech and mental health: Oxford study finds no link
description: The Oxford study used data from more than 430,000 young people, gathered over 28 years.

title: India passes 20 million cases amid oxygen shortage
description: Officials say infections are slowing, but erratic testing and under-reporting cast doubt on their claims.

title: Fight Talk: 'Dead in the water' to 'this fight is on' - the Anthony Joshua v Tyson Fury saga continues
description: Bob Arum says it is "dead in the water" but Eddie Hearn says "this fight is on". The Anthony Joshua v Tyson Fury saga continues, plus more boxing news and reaction.

title: The Papers: 'Wish EU were here' and holiday spots 'to reopen'
description: Tuesday's front pages focus on the prospect of Britons being able to travel abroad this summer.

title: Five Eyes: Is the alliance in trouble over China?
description: The Five Eyes intelligence alliance has expanded into politics but faces a split in dealing with Beijing.

title: The rise of India's 'Covid quack'
description: An anti-vaccine doctor falsely claims to be able to cure coronavirus, diabetes and Aids through diet alone
